5#ifndef V8_HEAP_LARGE_SPACES_H_
6#define V8_HEAP_LARGE_SPACES_H_

8#include <atomic>
9#include <functional>
10#include <memory>
11#include <unordered_map>
12
13#include "src/base/macros.h"
14#include "src/base/platform/mutex.h"
15#include "src/common/globals.h"
16#include "src/heap/heap-verifier.h"
17#include "src/heap/heap.h"
18#include "src/heap/large-page.h"

21#include "src/objects/heap-object.h"

23namespace v8 {
24namespace internal {
25
26class Isolate;
27class LocalHeap;
28
29// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
30// Large objects ( > kMaxRegularHeapObjectSize ) are allocated and managed by
31// the large object space. Large objects do not move during garbage collections.
32
33class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE LargeObjectSpace : public Space {
34 public:
35 using iterator = LargePageIterator;
36 using const_iterator = ConstLargePageIterator;
37
38 ~LargeObjectSpace() override { TearDown(); }
39
40 // Releases internal resources, frees objects in this space.
41 void TearDown();
42
43 // Available bytes for objects in this space.
44 size_t Available() const override;
45
46 size_t Size() const override { return size_; }
47 size_t SizeOfObjects() const override { return objects_size_; }
48
49 // Approximate amount of physical memory committed for this space.
50 size_t CommittedPhysicalMemory() const override;
51
52 int PageCount() const { return page_count_; }
53
54 void ShrinkPageToObjectSize(LargePageMetadata* page,
55 Tagged<HeapObject> object, size_t object_size);
56
57 // Checks whether a heap object is in this space; O(1).
58 bool Contains(Tagged<HeapObject> obj) const;
59 // Checks whether an address is in the object area in this space. Iterates all
60 // objects in the space. May be slow.
61 bool ContainsSlow(Address addr) const;
62
63 // Checks whether the space is empty.
64 bool IsEmpty() const { return first_page() == nullptr; }
65
66 virtual void AddPage(LargePageMetadata* page, size_t object_size);
67 virtual void RemovePage(LargePageMetadata* page);
68
69 LargePageMetadata* first_page() override {
70 return reinterpret_cast<LargePageMetadata*>(memory_chunk_list_.front());
71 }
72 const LargePageMetadata* first_page() const override {
73 return reinterpret_cast<const LargePageMetadata*>(
74 memory_chunk_list_.front());
75 }
76
77 iterator begin() { return iterator(first_page()); }
78 iterator end() { return iterator(nullptr); }
79
80 const_iterator begin() const { return const_iterator(first_page()); }
81 const_iterator end() const { return const_iterator(nullptr); }
82
83 std::unique_ptr<ObjectIterator> GetObjectIterator(Heap* heap) override;
84
85 void AddAllocationObserver(AllocationObserver* observer);
86 void RemoveAllocationObserver(AllocationObserver* observer);
87
88#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
89 void Verify(Isolate* isolate, SpaceVerificationVisitor* visitor) const final;
90#endif
91
92#ifdef DEBUG
93 void Print() override;
94#endif
95
96 // The last allocated object that is not guaranteed to be initialized when the
97 // concurrent marker visits it.
98 Address pending_object() const {
99 return pending_object_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
100 }
101
102 void ResetPendingObject() {
103 pending_object_.store(0, std::memory_order_release);
104 }
105
106 base::SharedMutex* pending_allocation_mutex() {
107 return &pending_allocation_mutex_;
108 }
109
110 void set_objects_size(size_t objects_size) { objects_size_ = objects_size; }
111
112 protected:
113 LargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap, AllocationSpace id);
114
115 void AdvanceAndInvokeAllocationObservers(Address soon_object, size_t size);
116
117 LargePageMetadata* AllocateLargePage(int object_size,
118 Executability executable);
119
120 void UpdatePendingObject(Tagged<HeapObject> object);
121
122 std::atomic<size_t> size_; // allocated bytes
123 int page_count_; // number of chunks
124 std::atomic<size_t> objects_size_; // size of objects
125 // The mutex has to be recursive because profiler tick might happen while
126 // holding this lock, then the profiler will try to iterate the call stack
127 // which might end up calling CodeLargeObjectSpace::FindPage() and thus
128 // trying to lock the mutex for a second time.
129 base::RecursiveMutex allocation_mutex_;
130
131 // Current potentially uninitialized object. Protected by
132 // pending_allocation_mutex_.
133 std::atomic<Address> pending_object_;
134
135 // Used to protect pending_object_.
136 base::SharedMutex pending_allocation_mutex_;
137
138 AllocationCounter allocation_counter_;
139
140 private:
141 friend class LargeObjectSpaceObjectIterator;
142};
143
144class OldLargeObjectSpace : public LargeObjectSpace {
145 public:
146 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE explicit OldLargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap);
147
148 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT AllocationResult
149 AllocateRaw(LocalHeap* local_heap, int object_size);
150
151 void PromoteNewLargeObject(LargePageMetadata* page);
152
153 protected:
154 explicit OldLargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap, AllocationSpace id);
155 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT AllocationResult AllocateRaw(LocalHeap* local_heap,
156 int object_size,
157 Executability executable);
158};
159
160class SharedLargeObjectSpace : public OldLargeObjectSpace {
161 public:
162 explicit SharedLargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap);
163};
164
165// Similar to the TrustedSpace, but for large objects.
166class TrustedLargeObjectSpace : public OldLargeObjectSpace {
167 public:
168 explicit TrustedLargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap);
169};
170
171// Similar to the TrustedLargeObjectSpace, but for shared objects.
172class SharedTrustedLargeObjectSpace : public OldLargeObjectSpace {
173 public:
174 explicit SharedTrustedLargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap);
175};
176
177class NewLargeObjectSpace : public LargeObjectSpace {
178 public:
179 NewLargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap, size_t capacity);
180
181 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT AllocationResult
182 AllocateRaw(LocalHeap* local_heap, int object_size);
183
184 // Available bytes for objects in this space.
185 size_t Available() const override;
186
187 void Flip();
188
189 void FreeDeadObjects(const std::function<bool(Tagged<HeapObject>)>& is_dead);
190
191 void SetCapacity(size_t capacity);
192
193 private:
194 size_t capacity_;
195};
196
197class CodeLargeObjectSpace : public OldLargeObjectSpace {
198 public:
199 explicit CodeLargeObjectSpace(Heap* heap);
200
201 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT AllocationResult
202 AllocateRaw(LocalHeap* local_heap, int object_size);
203
204 protected:
205 void AddPage(LargePageMetadata* page, size_t object_size) override;
206 void RemovePage(LargePageMetadata* page) override;
207};
208
209class LargeObjectSpaceObjectIterator : public ObjectIterator {
210 public:
211 explicit LargeObjectSpaceObjectIterator(LargeObjectSpace* space);
212
213 Tagged<HeapObject> Next() override;
214
215 private:
216 LargePageMetadata* current_;
217};
218
219} // namespace internal
220} // namespace v8
221
222#endif // V8_HEAP_LARGE_SPACES_H_
